abstract.p: Correction of Dec 25 article on federal appeals courts' rules against citing one-time rulings as precedent regarding date for end of such a restriction

block.p: An article on Dec. 25 about federal appeals courts' rules against citing one-time rulings as precedent misstated the date for the end of such a restriction in the Court of Appeals for the District of Columbia Circuit. Because of an editing error, the article also misstated the policy of the Court of Appeals for the First Circuit. The District of Columbia restriction ended on Jan. 1, 2002, not 2003. The First Circuit eased its restriction on Dec. 16; the change was not still pending.
